member.name: M:HotelBookingSystem.Application.Services.GuestService.GetRecentlyVisitedHotelsAsync(System.Guid,System.Int32)
member.summary: Retrieves a collection of unique recently visited hotels for a guest, presenting essential details.
member.param: The unique identifier of the guest for whom recently visited hotels are to be retrieved.
The maximum number of unique recently visited hotels to retrieve. Default is 5.

remarks.para: This method asynchronously retrieves recent bookings associated with the specified guest, including information about the booked rooms and their respective hotels. It then maps the relevant details to a simplified hotels model, , for a cleaner representation of the data. The resulting collection provides essential information about the unique recently visited hotels, such as hotel name, city name, star rating, and price.

member.returns: An asynchronous task representing the operation, returning a collection of unique recently visited hotels.

member.name: M:HotelBookingSystem.Application.Services.GuestService.GetRecentlyVisitedHotelsForCurrentUserAsync(System.Int32)
member.summary: Retrieves a collection of unique recently visited hotels for a guest (current logged in guest), presenting essential details.
member.param: The maximum number of unique recently visited hotels to retrieve. Default is 5.

remarks.para: This method asynchronously retrieves recent bookings associated with the specified guest, including information about the booked rooms and their respective hotels. It then maps the relevant details to a simplified hotels model, , for a cleaner representation of the data. The resulting collection provides essential information about the unique recently visited hotels, such as hotel name, city name, star rating, and price.
This method is intended to be used by the current logged in guest, and therefore does not require a guestId parameter.
This method internally depends on the

member.returns: An asynchronous task representing the operation, returning a collection of unique recently visited hotels.

member.name: M:HotelBookingSystem.Application.Validation.Common.ValidationExtensions.ValidName``1(FluentValidation.IRuleBuilder{``0,System.String},System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Validates that a string property contains only letters and has a length within the specified range.
member.typeparam: The type of the object being validated.
member.param: The rule builder on which the validation rule is being defined.
The minimum length of the string. Defaults to 2 characters.
The maximum length of the string. Defaults to 35 characters.
member.remarks:
This validation method checks that the property is not empty, contains only letters (including special characters like commas, hyphens, and spaces), and has a length within the specified range.
If the validation fails, appropriate error messages are returned to indicate the specific violation
member.returns: Rule builder options for further chaining validation rules.

member.name: M:HotelBookingSystem.Application.Validation.Common.ValidationExtensions.ValidNumericString``1(FluentValidation.IRuleBuilder{``0,System.String},System.Int32)
member.summary: Extension method to validate if a string is a numeric string of a specific length.
member.typeparam: The type of the object being validated.
member.param: The rule builder on which the validation rule is being defined.
The exact length the numeric string should be.
member.returns: Rule builder options for further chaining validation rules.

member.name: M:HotelBookingSystem.Application.Validation.Common.ValidationExtensions.StrongPassword``1(FluentValidation.IRuleBuilder{``0,System.String})
member.summary: Extension method to validate a password for complexity requirements. It ensures that the password is a minimum of 6 characters in length and includes at least one uppercase letter, one lowercase letter, one number, and one special character.
member.typeparam: The type of the object being validated.
member.param: The rule builder on which the validation rule is being defined.
member.returns: Rule builder options for further chaining validation rules.
